intro: Urtica stachyoides, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its hollow,螫刺 (stinging) stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the Urticaceae family. Urtica stachyoides thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed areas. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
